messages: 960e64bc67ba430c9521b661a1f9d781 (07:45): is there an easy way to display two different sites on the same page with frames?
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (08:14): Line : 35 (Level : 1) You have no color with your background-color : .header
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (08:14): is it complaining because I have  both a background-color and a background-image?
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (08:15): it looks fine to me
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (08:15): or does it require a color property as well?
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (08:33): what is the order for padding

c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (08:39): Nanobot: the following is a bit confusing: "XML also uses a different character for the closing Null End Tag delimiter: ‚Äú>‚Äú. Therefore, a Null End Tag in XML looks like this: <br/>, which people familiar with XML should recognize."
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (08:47): hmm, probably a html attribute
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (08:48): theTrav: scan that for the readonly
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (08:51): thanks command I didn't know the attr syntax for RTFS
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (08:52): IE allows a top margin for body but not a bottom margin?
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (08:52): the attr syntax doesn't appear to be working..

c191a0a89c262a71d9f04c459446f999 (08:52): deadroot: margin-bottom { IE 6: 50% | IE 7: 60% | Firefox 1.5: Y | Opera 9: Y } http://www.webdevout.net/browser_support_css.php#support-css2propsbasic-marginbottom
a0e4ec720a249a3e5162548adbcc8f4f (08:53): lemme recall, yes it does margins on body just fine
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (08:54): not with scroll bar as far as I can tell
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (08:56): I've got a margin on the top that moves the scroll bar start down, but the same margin on the bottom doesn't move the bottom up
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (08:56): so I've got a footer div that is overlapping the scrollbar
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (08:57): that gives me a bottom margin
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:00): aren't html head and body tags required?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (09:00): theTrav: only if you don't want to be mocked
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:01): it gives you a margin top and bottom but does not move the scrollbar
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:02): theTrav: what do you mean by the scrollbar?
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:03): is an example of my problem
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:05): bar on the right that scrolls
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:05): you know the scroll bar
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:06): look at my example, it takes the scroll bar off the html element, attaches it to the body element, and because the body element is moved down it's doing ok
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:06): but because the body element extends past the end of the html page the bottom of it gets cut off
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:06): so I guess what I need to do is have the body element never get bigger than the window
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:13): man, that was a big pain in the ass
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:32): deadroot, I took a 2500 line html page and converted it to html4.01 strict
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:33): with valid css and javascript that works on Mozilaa and IE6
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:33): and the javascripts are separated into modules that have minimal dependancies that are clearly commented
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:34): now I have the fun task of migrating this page back into struts >_<
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:34): I wish they'd let me change frameworks
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:34): theTrav: sorry. i meant how did you do the framing?
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:35): umm, I gave the html element padding top and bottom equal to the header and footer heights
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:35): and had the body height=100%
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:35): to get it to work in firefox there's a bit of a hack with body>.myClass{position:fixed;}
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:35): but Ithink that is a different issue
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:36): it's still a bit foggy
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:37): yeah, i'm also having probs with ff
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:37): it's only using a top margin, but setting a bottom margin will work fine
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:37): FF the scroll bars are outside the html element as far as I can tell
d95f53138bf80f030ec8a191c11ab2ed (09:37): it's not identical but it's equivalent
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (09:43): it's okay. i got the idea for the IE. i'm just figuring out how to do the same for FF

01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (10:02): deadroot: It depends on which XML SGML profile you're talking about. They have a profile that's compatible with the classic SGML declaration format, as well as the extended one. The classic one has NET as "/>", while the extended as NET as "/" and NESTC or whatever as ">".
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (10:03): The extended one is more true to the rules of XML. The classic one is purely for compatibility
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (10:04): why did Minibot do that?
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (10:05): ;blah searches for a link on "blah". It seems it thought the a element was a match for ">.>"
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (10:08): Holy crap. Microsoft just closed all of the IE feedback bug reports, asking everyone to manually reopen them if they still apply
1c7f00e4057d97c61c62ee266d1fa423 (10:08): microsoft attempted to go web standards with their site
c8036b7fc3fa351a2f522a7beadf7ce1 (10:09): for a mega corporation, that's pretty irresponsible of them
01f60b3e30620d99648888f668e7da88 (10:13): Well I went ahead and reopened the ones I filed

6df7e24aca088deaef07ca2df0250747 (10:18): Mostly are doing for the standards push, though we can't get them to bend all the way. :)

6df7e24aca088deaef07ca2df0250747 (10:28): Haha no, we're in a great relationship with them.
